bugs.summary: CVE-2010-1871 JBoss Seam / Seam2: Improper sanitization of parametrized JBoss EL expressions (ACE)

description:
The JBoss Seam Framework is an application framework for building web
applications in Java.

An input sanitization flaw was found in the way JBoss Seam processed
certain parametrized JBoss Expression Language (EL) expressions. A remote
attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code via a URL,
containing appended, specially-crafted expression language parameters,
provided to certain applications based on the JBoss Seam framework. Note: A
properly configured and enabled Java Security Manager would prevent
exploitation of this flaw. (CVE-2010-1871)

Red Hat would like to thank Meder Kydyraliev of Google Security Team for
responsibly reporting this issue.
solution:
This issue is fixed by a security patch JBPAPP-4714.zip.  To download an update
which contains a fix for this issue please log into the customer portal and
visit
https://access.redhat.com/jbossnetwork/restricted/listSoftware.html

Replace jboss-seam.jar in your web application. Copy the new jboss-seam.jar to
your web application libraries.  The JBoss server process
must be restarted for this update to take effect.
